problem.title: Valid Palindrome II
problem.description:
Given a string s, you may delete at most one character to make it a valid palindrome. Return true if the string can be a palindrome after deleting at most one character, otherwise return false.

A valid palindrome is a string that reads the same forwards and backwards.

You need to determine if by removing 0 or 1 character from the string, you can make it a palindrome.
constraints: s consists of lowercase and uppercase English letters
Time Complexity: O(n) where n is the length of the string
Space Complexity: O(1) - only using constant extra space

examples.explanation: The string "aba" is already a palindrome, so we return true. We don't need to delete any character.
We can delete the character 'c' to get "aba" which is a palindrome. So we return true.
No matter which character we delete, the resulting string is not a palindrome. So we return false.
